meanings.definition: A person who claims or aspires to a particular position or status without necessarily having the qualifications or right to do so.
meanings.sent1: The pretender tried to become the king even though he wasn't chosen.
meanings.sent2: The pretender at school said he was the best at everything.
meanings.sent3: The pretender in the game thought he could win without practicing.
meanings.sent4: She saw him as a pretender to the throne, not a true heir.
meanings.sent5: The pretender's false crown quickly slipped from his head.

meanings.definition: A person who makes false claims or assumptions.
meanings.sent1: The pretender in the story claimed to be a long-lost prince.
meanings.sent2: The pretender's lies were exposed when the truth came out.
meanings.sent3: The pretender's tall tales always made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: She saw through his facade and recognized him as a pretender.
meanings.sent5: The pretender's deceitful smile revealed his true intentions.
